notes: Saab 96 compact sedan. Two-stroke three-cylinder engine (1960-1967), then Ford V4 (1967-1980). Front-wheel drive with freewheel mechanism. Aircraft-inspired design, rally heritage. Limited US imports. Vintage mechanical complexity. Data sourced from Wikipedia Saab 96 article, January 2025 revision.

Saab Sonett II (1966-1967) and Sonett V4 (1967-1970). Lightweight fiberglass body sports car. Two-stroke initially, Ford V4 from 1967. Front-wheel drive. Limited production, rare in North America. Data sourced from Wikipedia Saab Sonett article, January 2025 revision.
